page.title: 06Religion in N.E.Bolton
page.content: The area abounds in churches of different denominations. St.Maxentius,Bradshaw is the main Anglican church and has a 16th century tower standing next to the church.The vicar,Mr Dunn,moved into the parish three years ago.St.Andrews,Bromley Cross is also Anglican. There are two Roman Catholic churches,St.John's at Bromley Cross and St.Brendan's at Harwood. Methodist chapels include those found at Bromley Cross,Longsight and Tottington Road.Other religious buildings include the new Cornerstone Baptist Church at Bromley Cross,United Reform and Presbyterian at Walsh's Institute.Riding Gate has a mission hall that is housed in a tin hut. Despite this variety there are no mosques or temples because Hindus and Moslems do not tend to live here.
